snippet: Calling their project “Shazam for Mosquitoes,” Stanford students showed that common mobile phones could distinguish the hums of beating wings, which could prove useful in fighting diseases....
abstract: Student researchers at Standord University's Bio-X institute find cellphones are capable of recording mosquito hums in enough detail to determine one type of mosquito from another; researchers envision future in which cellphone users may participate in tracking and fighting mosquito-borne diseases like West Nile virus and Zika.
lead_paragraph: Calling their project “Shazam for Mosquitoes,” Stanford students showed that common mobile phones could distinguish the hums of beating wings, which could prove useful in fighting diseases.

headline.print_headline: Telling Mosquitoes Apart With a Cellphone
headline.main: Telling Mosquitoes Apart With a Cellphone

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: American Society of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene
